abstract: Developer Centaur Properties has gone against the flow in Manhattan, where poor sales and tighter lending restrictions have pushed many developers to turn condominium projects into rental buildings; Centaur has abandoned plans to lease all 53 apartments in new rental construction at 305 West 16th Street in favor of selling them as condominium units.
snippet: A developer first conceived of 305 West 16th Street as a rental, but decided to sell the 53 units as condos and turn the ground level into retail space.
lead_paragraph: A developer first conceived of 305 West 16th Street as a rental, but decided to sell the 53 units as condos and turn the ground level into retail space.

headline.main: Sales Over Rentals, Even in a Credit Crunch
headline.seo: Posting - A Chelsea Building Shifts to Condops
headline.print_headline: Sales Over Rentals, Even in a Credit Crunch
